data.event: This area of Osage County was settled by German Lutherans in the 1860s, and a small catholic church, St. John's Lutheran Church, at Babbtown was built in 1871.
The congregation still meets in the original building, which was constructed in 1873.

event.title: were discovered in the hewn log sills in the 1990s

data.event: When termites were discovered in the hewn log sills in the 1990s, congregation members rebuilt the foundation by jacking up the walls section-by-section and cutting out and replacing the termite-riddled timbers and wall structure.
The old schoolhouse was expanded in the 1970s and again in the 1990s, and is now used as a parish building.
The old schoolhouse was expanded in the 1970s and again in the 1990s, and is now used as a parish building.

event.title: 1900, however, the Rock Island Railroad was built

data.event: Around 1900, however, the Rock Island Railroad was built through what is today the town of Meta, and as that town grew, Babbtown dwindled away.

event.title: today the town of Meta, and as that town grew
